Systems Biology Workbench (SBW)

edu.caltech.sbw
Class SBWListener

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.SBWListener
public abstract class SBWListener
extends java.lang.Object

An abstract adapter class for receiving notifications of certain events in SBW. The methods in this class are empty. This class exists as a convenience for creating SBW Listener objects.

Listeners are used in SBW to notify an application that certain events have occurred. A listener may be registered or deregistered with SBW using the methods SBW.addListener(edu.caltech.sbw.SBWListener) and SBW.removeListener(edu.caltech.sbw.SBWListener).

Extend this class to create an SBW Listener and override the methods for the particular events of interest. Since this class defines null methods, you only have to define methods for the events that you care about.

Version:
$Revision: 1.7 $
Author:
Michael Hucka, $Author: mhucka $

Constructor Detail

SBWListener

public SBWListener()
Method Detail

onModuleShutdown

public void onModuleShutdown(Module module)
This method on the listener is called every time a module instance somewhere in the SBW system disconnects from the SBW Broker. The module passed to the method represents the module instance that has just shut down.

Parameters:
module - the module that has just shut down

onModuleStart

public void onModuleStart(Module module)
This method on the listener is called every time a module instance starts up or connects to the SBW Broker. The module passed to the method represents the module instance that has just started up.

Parameters:
module - the module that has just started up

onRegistrationChange

public void onRegistrationChange()
This method on the listener is called whenever a registration change for a module occurs in the SBW Broker. "Registration changes" are: a module registering itself with the Broker, a module registering a service with the Broker, or a module being unregistered.
